title: Past Simple or Past Continuous 3
instructions: Complete the sentences with the verbs. Use B1past simpleB2 or B1past continuousB2.

sentence: (kiss) with her boyfriend on her sofa in her room when her mother
explain: Corr: was kissing. It's past continuous because this action was in progress and was interrupted when the mother opened the door.
Corr: opened. It's past simple because this action was not interrupted by any other actions.

sentence: (hear) some noise from the kitchen. I
explain: Corr: were watching. It's past continuous because this action was in progress when the action in the next clause happened.
Corr: heard. It's past simple. The verb 'hear' cannot be used in the continuous.
Corr: went. It's past simple because this action was not interrupted by anything else.
Corr: saw. It's past simple because this action was not interrupted by anything else.
Corr: was playing. It's past continuous because this action was in progress when 'I saw that the cat...'.

sentence: (try) to open the door of her flat when a man
(go) up to her to help her. However, she
explain: Corr: was trying. It's past continuous because this action was in progress when the 'man went up to her'.
Corr: went. It's past simple because this action was not interrupted by anything else.
Corr: got. It's past simple because this action was not interrupted by anything else. It followed the previous action.
Corr: screamed. It's past simple because this action was not interrupted by anything else.

sentence: (think) about going to the railway station when my phone
explain: Corr: did. It's past simple because the speaker asks about the next action the other person did after 'he finished packing'.
Corr: do. It's past simple because the speaker asks about the next action the other person did after 'he finished packing'.
Corr: finished. It's past simple because this action was not interrupted by anything else.
Corr: was thinking. It's past continuous because this action was in progress 'when his phone rang'.
Corr: rang. It's past simple because it was not interrupted by anything else.
Corr: asked. It's past simple because it was not interrupted by any other action. We look at this action as a whole.

sentence: (put) the money in my pocket and
explain: Corr: looked. It's past simple because it was not interrupted by anything else.
Corr: realised. It's past simple because it was not interrupted by anything else.
Corr: was watching. It's past continuous because this was happening at that moment, it started before 'I looked around'.
Corr: put. It's past simple because it was not interrupted by anything else.
Corr: left. It's past simple because it was not interrupted by anything else, it just followed the previous action.

sentence: (live) in the country. Only after I
explain: Corr: lived. It's past simple because it was not interrupted by anything.
Corr: turned. It's past simple because it was not interrupted by anything.
Corr: left. It's past simple because it was not interrupted by any other action.
Corr: was raining. It's past continuous because this action was in progress, it started before 'I left home'.
Corr: arrived. It's past simple because it was not interrupted by any other action.
Corr: was shining. It's past continuous because this action was in progress, it started before 'I arrived at work'.

sentence: (walk) in the city when two tourists
explain: Corr: were walking. It's past continuous because this action was in progress when the 'two tourists stopped us'.
Corr: stopped. It's past simple because this action was not interrupted by anything else.
Corr: asked. It's past simple because this action was not interrupted by anything else.
Corr: were looking. It's past continuous because it was in progress, the tourists started looking for the Basilica before they 'stopped us'.
